organic_results.title: Latent messages: The acoustical environments of kindergartens in Israel and West Germany
organic_results.snippet: This study of kindergartens in West Germany and Israel traced the ways in which educational policies and pedagogical codes are translated into kindergarten performances. As a test of the effects of different pedagogical codes, the author mapped patterns of dominance-control and patterns of action in the acoustical environments of kindergarten sessions and analyzed the overall acoustical context independently. The author concludes that the results confirm Bernstein's theory of the possible effects of different codes of …

publication_info.summary: D Kalekin-Fishman - Sociology of Education, 1991 - JSTOR
